meanings.definition: Cause the death of (a person, animal, or other living thing)
meanings.sent1: The hunter aimed carefully to kill the deer.
meanings.sent2: The virus can kill thousands of people if not controlled.
meanings.sent3: I laughed so hard at the joke, it nearly killed me.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat in the desert can kill even the strongest plants.
meanings.sent5: The assassin's job is to kill silently and swiftly.

meanings.sent1: The superhero used his powers to kill the evil villain.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters worked hard to kill the raging flames.
meanings.sent3: I had to kill my old computer as it was too slow to use.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds can kill any hope of a peaceful day.
meanings.sent5: The company decided to kill the project due to lack of funding.

meanings.definition: Overwhelm with an emotion or a strong feeling
meanings.sent1: The surprise party planned for her birthday will kill her with joy.
meanings.sent2: The touching movie scene always kills me with sadness.
meanings.sent3: His dance moves are so bad, they kill me with laughter every time.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful sunset view can kill you with awe and wonder.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt letter from her friend will kill her with gratitude.
